game.engine.models.xml

Class XmlNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.engine.models.xml.XmlNode

  • public class XmlNode
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a node in an XML file. This contains the name of the node, a map of the attributes and their values, any text data between the start and end tag, and a list of all its children nodes.
    Author:
    Karl

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Gets a certain child node of this node.

      Get the child nodes of this node that have a given name.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        The name of the XML node.

      • getData

        public java.lang.String getData()
        Returns:
        Any text data contained between the start and end tag of the node.

      • getAttribute

        public java.lang.String getAttribute(java.lang.String attr)
        Gets the value of a certain attribute of the node. Returns null if the attribute doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        attr - - attribute name.
        Returns:
        The value of the attribute.

      • getChild

        public XmlNode getChild(java.lang.String childName)
        Gets a certain child node of this node.
        Parameters:
        childName - - the name of the child node.
        Returns:
        The child XML node with the given name.

      • getChildWithAttribute

        public XmlNode getChildWithAttribute(java.lang.String childName,
                                     java.lang.String attr,
                                     java.lang.String value)
        Gets a child node with a certain name, and with a given value of a given attribute. Used to get a specific child when there are multiple child nodes with the same node name.
        Parameters:
        childName - - the name of the child node.
        attr - - the attribute whose value is to be checked.
        value - - the value that the attribute must have.
        Returns:
        The child node which has the correct name and the correct value for the chosen attribute.

      • getChildren

        public java.util.List<XmlNode> getChildren(java.lang.String name)
        Get the child nodes of this node that have a given name.
        Parameters:
        name - - the name of the child nodes.
        Returns:
        A list of the child nodes with the given name. If none exist then an empty list is returned.
